H0.text: what type of government does usa follow. Constitutional Democracy

H1.text: what type of government does usa follow. Representative Democracy

H2.text: what type of government does usa follow. Presidential System

H3.text: what type of government does usa follow. Federal republic

A4.text: A federal republic is a federation of states with a republic as a form of government.

A5.text: The literal meaning of the word republic when used to reference a form of government means a country that is governed by elected representatives and by an elected leader, such as a president, rather than by a monarch or any hereditary aristocracy.

A6.text: The executive branch is established in Article Two of the United States Constitution, which vests executive power in the president of the United States.

A7.text: Each state is allocated two senators regardless of its population.
